rComments: Course code wasn't listed but I took an honours seminar with him. He is a tough grader and expects active participation with your camera on & verbal contribution every class in addition to well thought-out discussion posts (500+ words) every week without fail. Every class is a discussion and he does not teach. Worst part of my week. Cheers!

Overall, the course itself is not bad. The topics he chooses to introduce are quite interesting but here's the gag: he doesn't teach them. Instead, it's all discussion during class between him and mostly the students. If you don't participate, your overall grade will suffer. Participation counts for 20% and that means actively speaking in class.

If you want to learn from your classmates, take prof Heffernans class. Every lecture is a discussion while he sits back and listens. Course engagement worth 20% of our final grade in an online semester in the middle of a pandemic. Tough grader to top it off. He is still a student yet completely out of tune with student concerns

Professor Heffernan is knowledgeable and gives good feedback, but has a high standard of excellence. Tough grader on assignments and requires active participation every lecture (plus discussion posts) just to pass with a 50% in participation. I recommend him if you're outgoing and extremely interested in the content; if not, avoid at all costs.
